summary: This is a request from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Judge Paul G. Gardephe to file under seal a portion of the sentencing transcript from the Jeffrey Epstein case. The redactions concern remarks by defense counsel about the investigation into Epstein's death and potential misconduct at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Investigation into Epstein's Death
events.description: Defense counsel's remarks at sentencing mentioned the ongoing government investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death and potential misconduct by officials at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

locations: Thurgood Marshall U.S. Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A portion of the sentencing transcript in the Jeffrey Epstein case was sealed on September 12, 2019, due to remarks about the investigation into his death.
The redactions proposed by the parties are specifically on pages 14-15 and 21 of the transcript.
The redactions concern discussions of potential misconduct by officials at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, where Epstein died.
This document is a formal request from the U.S. Attorney's Office to make those redactions official and keep that portion of the transcript under seal.
